text.__SUMMARY__: Psilocybe eximia is a species of psilocybin mushroom in the family Strophariaceae. It is found in Java, Indonesia, where it grows in muddy soil among ferns, grasses, moss, and leaf litter. The fungus was described as new to science in 2006 by mycologists Egon Horak and Dennis Desjardin.
